dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Twitter, uh, just made a pretty bold move. Dorsey announced they're completely banning political ads on their platform. Like, effective immediately, almost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is a huge contrast to Facebook, obviously. Twitter's reasoning was that political message reach should be, you know, "earned, not bought."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Dorsey was pretty clear, saying this isn't about free expression, it's about paying for reach. And he thinks paying to increase that reach, especially for political speech, has "significant ramifications" our democratic infrastructure just isn't ready for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Dorsey was pretty clear, saying this isn't about free expression, it's about paying for reach. And he thinks paying to increase that reach, especially for political speech, has significant ramifications our democratic infrastructure just isn't ready for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This isnt about free expression, Dorsey said in a series of tweets. This is about paying for reach. And paying to increase the reach of political speech has significant ramifications that todays democratic infrastructure may not be prepared to handle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, I mean, is a direct jab at Zuckerberg's stance. Facebook's policy, as we know, allows politicians to make, uh, potentially false claims in ads, all under the umbrella of free speech.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Zuckerberg's basically positioned Facebook as this American-values-based company, championing free speech, saying he doesn't think people want tech companies judging what's 100% true.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Zuckerberg's basically positioned Facebook as this American-values-based company, championing free speech, saying he doesn't think people want tech companies judging what's one hundred percent true.
